qas.question: According to goverment officials, what has the failure of the private sector to solve efficiently the cybersecurity problem created?
Where was the RSA Security Conference held?
Who believes that government intervention would affect innovation?
Who said "industry only responds when you threaten regulation"?
What is a virtual space free of any government intervention?

plausible_answers.text: whether the government should intervene or not in the regulation of the cyberspace

qas.question: What is the polemical problem presented?

plausible_answers.text: cyberspace is a virtual space free of any government intervention.

qas.question: What is considered vital of the internet?

plausible_answers.text: industry only responds when you threaten regulation

qas.question: Is the cyberspace industry under attack or threatened by regulation?

plausible_answers.text: the private sector agree that improvements are necessary, but think that the government intervention would affect their ability to innovate efficiently.

qas.question: Who believes they are better at improving cyberspace?

plausible_answers.text: whether the government should intervene or not

qas.question: What do most people agree on in regards to internet security?

plausible_answers.text: industry only responds when you threaten regulation

qas.question: Why did R. Clarke want to avoid government intervention?
Where is government intervention most common?
Why is threatening an industry unhelpful according to Clarke?

context: The question of <b5_0><b10_0>whether the government should intervene or not<b10_0/> in the regulation of the cyberspace<b5_0/> is a very polemical one. Indeed, for as long as it has existed and by definition, the <a4_0><b6_0><b12_0>cyberspace<b12_0/><a4_0/> is a virtual space free of any government intervention.<b6_0/> Where everyone agree that an improvement on cybersecurity is more than vital, is the government the best actor to solve this issue? Many government officials and experts think that the government should step in and that there is <a0_0>a crucial need for regulation<a0_0/>, mainly due to the failure of <b7_0>the private sector<b7_0/> to solve efficiently the cybersecurity problem. <a3_0>R. Clarke<a3_0/> said during a panel discussion at the RSA Security Conference in <a1_0><b14_0>San Francisco<b14_0/><a1_0/>, he believes that the "<b8_0><b11_0>industry only responds when you threaten regulation<b11_0/><b8_0/>. If <b13_0>industry doesn't respond (to the threat)<b13_0/>, you have to follow through." On the other hand, <a2_0>executives from <b9_0>the private sector<a2_0/> agree that improvements are necessary, but think that the government intervention would affect their ability to innovate efficiently.
